description: {"blocks":[{"key":"d4917","text":"In this protocol we describe the preparation and maintenance of rat organotypic cultures (cortico-striatal) for AAV-infection and imaging of the extracellular matrix. The AAV, in this case, induces the expression of a exportable hyaluronan-binding protein (Neurocan) fused with GFP, that allows vital labeling (and hence live imaging) of the extracellular matrix. The organotypic cultures can be maintained for several weeks, allowing for repeated imaging and longitudinal studies.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":90,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

related_materials.name: Horse Serum, heat inactivated, New Zealand origin
HBSS, no calcium, no magnesium, no phenol red
Millipore Cell Culture Inserts (0.4 um pore size, 30 mm diameter)

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fbdd3","text":"Prepare a 6-well culture plate with Millipore 0.4 µm culture inserts placed on 1 mL of organotypic medium per well, and incubate it at   and 5% CO2 to warm up.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":146,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":135,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ci9fu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"brtul","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d7joa","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"42m03","text":"    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2k2fm","text":"It is important to minimize air bubbles between the medium and the membrane insert, as this will prevent access of nutrients to the slice.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"je6","text":"Prepare a p100 and p60 petri dishes with 25 mL and 5 mL, respectively, of   and keep them   .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":73,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":90,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"40ij6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3et2s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":false,"cas_number":"","guid":"4267243C341F11EE9D4302C0B41BC903","linfor":"","mol_weight":0,"name":"HBSS, no calcium, no magnesium, no phenol red","pubchem_id":"0","public":1,"rrid":"","sku":"14175095","stats":{"total_protocols":0},"url":"https://www.thermofisher.com/order/catalog/product/14175095#/14175095","vendor":{"id":0,"image":{"placeholder":null,"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"},"is_requested":false,"link":"https://www.thermofisher.com/us/en/home.html","name":"Thermo Fisher Scientific"}}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":165}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"jqc0","text":"Sacrifice P5-P7 rat pups by rapid decapitation and extract the brain without damaging the cortex. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6nnoh","text":"Put the brain in the on a filter paper and cut through the midline to separate the cerebral hemispheres. Remove the midbrain, separating it from the cortex with a scalpel.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"apeii","text":"Place both hemispheres in the same holder plate, with the medial face downward. Hold the plate with both hemispheres perpendiculat to the blade (coronal sections) and section the brain at 350 um width.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ffm76","text":"Prepare the McIllwain Tissue Chopper (see Materials) with a fresh blade and clean holder plates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":12,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3noeb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1muoq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"agciv","text":"Pour the sliced brain carefully into the p100 petri dish with HBSS   . You may use a Pasteur pipette to moist the brain and displace it more easily.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":67,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"emt7p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":165}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"87mco","text":"Separate slices under the magnification microscope with a couple of spatulas (preferentially plastic-ones, which can be custom crafted cutting the back of a Pasteur pipette). Use a blade and clean cuts to remove unwanted regions (such as hippocampus or SVZ). Transfer the slices into the p60 petri dish (you can use an inverted glass pipette with a suction rubber bulb).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3cbu6","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ppba","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"45bcd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9rv2i","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dgu0s","text":"It is important to remove the subventricular zone (SVZ) and the meninges with the scalpel to avoid cell proliferation. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"frn1v","text":"Under the laminar flow hood, transfer the selected slices (undamaged slices from the preferred rostro-caudal levels) to preheated culture inserts with medium (Step 1). Each insert can only two cortico-striatal slices. Remove excess dissection buffer from the top of the insert with a sterile tip.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":27}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8j7lg","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"16b5c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6tona","text":"Leaving too much HBSS solution on top of the insert will eventually dilute the feeding medium.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9li37","text":"Incubate the culture at   and 5% CO2. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":35,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":24,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a2u81","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9500e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7qne3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"result","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1uq3b","text":"Typically, 4-6 cortico-striatal slices can be obtained from each hemisphere ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"62ta2","text":"At DIV1 (24h after culture preparation), replace the feeding medium with 1 mL of the same medium but adding antimitotic   4,4 um per well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":119,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"76dfi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9mi7h","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7ck09","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cas_number":"","group_reagent":{},"guid":"FE2B00E5617A437ABD5E2EE94E9847B6","id":"","linfor":"","mol_weight":0,"name":"Cytosine β-D-arabinofuranoside (AraC)","rrid":"","sku":"C1768","url":"https://www.sigmaaldrich.com/ES/es/product/sigma/c1768","vendor":{"id":17,"image":{"placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"},"is_requested":false,"link":"http://sigmaaldrich.com","name":"Merck MilliporeSigma (Sigma-Aldrich)"}}},"1":{"type":"result","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"al14r","text":"AraC will prevent the overproliferation of astrocytes, minimizing the formation of a glial scar on top of the slice.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ukpr","text":"At DIV3, replace the AraC-containing medium with fresh medium. Then add 1 uL of the virus of choice (in our case, AAV-Ncan-GFP 1012 vg/mL) over the slice. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":129,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"17ltv","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1cdcm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"412co","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"965tm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"u0t2","text":"AAVs have to be manipulated in BSL1 facilities.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7l3or","text":"To improve spatial precision (e.g. when infecting a selected region from the slice), AAV infection can be done with a micromanipulator and a glass pipette.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e68of","text":"To maintain the culture, change medium three times a week (1 mL per well).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eacom","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b9ucb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"result","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fs4qb","text":"Slices will flatten overtime, and become more transparent. Cortical regions will have more cell density than striatal regions.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"84sgt","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"32gqh","text":"AAV expression become visible aprox. at DIV10, with maximum expression from DIV14 onwards (it depends on AAV serotype and promoter).","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fn39v","text":"Imaging can be performed in two ways:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5g8tk","text":"IN-PLATE: The insert is not removed from the plate, and the imaging is performed through the plastic. This is usually done in widefield setups, with low magnification. It is not optimal in terms of resolution, but it is very useful for repeated imaging (longitudinal studies) without compromising sterility.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":21,"length":29},{"style":"italic","offset":126,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c31m8","text":"OFF-PLATE: The insert is removed from the plate and placed in a smaller petri-dish or similar holding chamber. Imaging is usually done from above, in upright microscopes (objective on-top), with water-based objectives. Since CO2 is usually not available, a buffer medium with HEPES is recommended. Phenol-red should be avoided as well, since it interferes with fluorescence. This type of configuration is typically used for confocal or 2-photon imaging of the slices. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":25,"length":22},{"style":"italic","offset":424,"length":8},{"style":"italic","offset":436,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
